definition: down and out/in dire straits/unrestrained/unconventional/also pr. [luo4 tuo4]
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body
dazed/beside oneself (idiom)
scared out of one's wits (idiom); in a panic
see 失魂落魄[shi1 hun2 luo4 po4]

sentences.english: What a comedown for the movement.
Abjection 3 people decide to form an alliance, revenge for each other.
sentences.chinese: 落魄的三人決定結盟，替彼此報仇。

sentences.english: There is no your news each time, I would be frightened of don't already daze.
sentences.chinese: 每次沒有了你的消息，我都會失魂落魄的茫然不已。

sentences.english: The wretched hold my banner high.
So many, fearful, took with them their sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 這麼多的人，失魂落魄，承受着悲哀。

sentences.english: Going there we gain a day, leaving we'll lose our mind.
sentences.chinese: 飛到那兒我們賺了一天，離開那兒我們失魂落魄。

sentences.english: It was hope that held my nerves from shock.
sentences.chinese: 只是懷着一線希望，我纔不致喪魂落魄。

sentences.english: So now the garret-dwellers have no excuses.
sentences.chinese: 所以那些居住閣樓的落魄藝術家，再也沒有藉口了。

sentences.english: "Isn't that the case?" Dr. Zhou said dejectedly .

sentences.chinese: 克里斯是一個落魄的人。

sentences.english: Hobo Chen Quan is abjection because of business failure.
sentences.chinese: 無業遊民陳全因生意失敗而落魄。

sentences.english: His wife left him last year, and he's been really frustrated since then.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子去年離開了他，從此他就失魂落魄。

sentences.english: Is this really what British democracy might have been reduced to?
sentences.chinese: 英國民主政府真的有可能落魄至此嗎？

sentences.english: After Joe broke up with his girl friend, he was out of it for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 自從喬和女友分手後，他失魂落魄了好幾個禮拜。
你看起來有點失魂落魄的。

sentences.english: When we were poor, you thought we were dogs.
sentences.chinese: 我們貧窮落魄，你認爲我們是豬玀。

definition: disappointed/frustrated/dejected
down and out/in dire straits/unrestrained/unconventional
to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
without a penny to one's name/penniless/stony-broke
to be penniless
down and out/in dire straits/unrestrained/unconventional
poverty stricken
penniless (idiom)
beggar
to degenerate/impoverished/to fall (into poverty)/to be reduced (to begging)
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
to be all alone in the world
disappointed/frustrated
destitute/wretched poverty
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
destitute and troubled/in dire straits
